title: Alternate Interior Angles with Parallel Lines (Correct)
theorem: If two parallel lines are cut by a transversal, then alternate interior angles are equal
given: Lines l and m are parallel. Transversal t intersects l at point A and m at point B.

steps.content: Since l || m, corresponding angles are equal by the Parallel Lines Postulate
Angle 1 (on line l, above transversal) and Angle 2 (on line m, above transversal) are corresponding angles, so Angle 1 = Angle 2
Angle 2 and Angle 3 (on line m, below transversal) are vertical angles, so Angle 2 = Angle 3
By transitivity, Angle 1 = Angle 3. Angle 1 and Angle 3 are alternate interior angles, completing the proof
